# GitHub Copilot Instructions

This file contains general coding guidelines and best practices for the Wallestars project.

## Code Quality

- Write clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Follow the principle of least surprise
- Prefer simple solutions over complex ones
- Avoid premature optimization

## Code Style

- Use consistent naming conventions throughout the project
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility
- Minimize code duplication
- Use meaningful variable and function names

## Security

- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, tokens) to the repository
- Validate and sanitize all user inputs
- Follow security best practices for the technologies used
- Address security vulnerabilities promptly

## Version Control

- Make atomic commits that represent a single logical change
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep the commit history clean and meaningful

## Documentation

- Document public APIs and complex algorithms
- Keep documentation synchronized with code changes
- Update README.md for significant feature additions
- Use comments to explain "why" not "what" when needed

## Collaboration

- Review code changes carefully before committing
- Be responsive to feedback and questions
- Maintain a professional and constructive tone in all communications
